CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Teams Connect chat enhancements
CurrentVersion.description: This roadmap item was cancelled as the feature was deprecated due to low usage. We apologize for any inconvenience. IT admins will be able to add external partners with phone-based Teams accounts not managed by an organization to their organization’s extended directory. These external users can have a company curated user profile including location and job role. Users in the organization, who are enabled for Teams external access, can search for these external users by name and establish 1:1 or group chats, just like they do with internal users.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Teams Connect chat enhancements
OldVersion.description: IT admins will be able to add external partners with phone-based Teams accounts not managed by an organization to their organization’s extended directory. These external users can have a company curated user profile including location and job role. Users in the organization, who are enabled for Teams external access, can search for these external users by name and establish 1:1 or group chats, just like they do with internal users.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Slash Commands
CurrentVersion.description: User will be able to type slash in Teams compose box and select a command, helping them complete their task quickly.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Slash Commands
OldVersion.description: User will be able to type slash in Teams compose box and select a command, helping them complete their task quickly.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal : Insider Risk Management – Bring your own detections
CurrentVersion.description:
Allow customers to bring their own user activity indicators from homegrown, SIEM/UEBA platforms, or other line-of-business applications, and leverage them in existing Insider Risk Management playbooks. Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/insider-risk-management?view=o365-worldwide

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal : Insider Risk Management – Bring your own detections
OldVersion.description:
Allow customers to bring their own user activity indicators from homegrown, SIEM/UEBA platforms, or other line-of-business applications, and leverage them in existing Insider Risk Management playbooks. Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.
More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/insider-risk-management?view=o365-worldwide

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Ability for meeting participants to edit their display name
CurrentVersion.description: Teams meeting participants will be able to edit their display name, enabling more flexibility in their meeting presence, regardless of their tenant set display name. Users can make this change during the meeting and it will persist throughout the duration of the meeting.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Ability for meeting participants to edit their display name
OldVersion.description: Teams meeting participants will be able to edit their display name, enabling more flexibility in their meeting presence, regardless of their tenant set display name. Users can make this change during the meeting and it will persist throughout the duration of the meeting.

CurrentVersion.title: SharePoint: Copilot in SharePoint
CurrentVersion.description: Copilot in SharePoint combines the power of Large Language Models (LLMs), your data in the Microsoft Graph, and best practices to create engaging web content.  Get assistance drafting your content when creating new pages. Adjust the tone, expand meeting bullets into structured text, or get help making your message more concise. All within our existing commitments to data security and privacy in the enterprise.

OldVersion.title: SharePoint: Copilot in SharePoint
OldVersion.description: Copilot in SharePoint combines the power of Large Language Models (LLMs), your data in the Microsoft Graph, and best practices to create engaging web content.  Get assistance drafting your content when creating new pages. Adjust the tone, expand meeting bullets into structured text, or get help making your message more concise. All within our existing commitments to data security and privacy in the enterprise.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection - Named entity coverage for additional markets and languages
CurrentVersion.description: Named entities are sensitive information types (SITs) that can’t easily be identified by a regular expression or a function; these include person names, physical addresses, and medical terms and conditions. This update expands name and address coverage to an additional 7 countries, such as China and Russia, and expands medical terms and conditions (specifically for the Diseases SIT) to an additional 29 languages covering much of Europe, China, Japan, and Korea.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection - Named entity coverage for additional markets and languages
OldVersion.description: Named entities are sensitive information types (SITs) that can’t easily be identified by a regular expression or a function; these include person names, physical addresses, and medical terms and conditions. This update expands name and address coverage to an additional 7 countries, such as China and Russia, and expands medical terms and conditions (specifically for the Diseases SIT) to an additional 29 languages covering much of Europe, China, Japan, and Korea.

This update expands name and address coverage to an additional 7 countries, such as China and Russia, and expands medical terms and conditions (specifically for the Diseases SIT) to an additional 29 languages covering much of Europe, China, Japan, and Korea.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection - Named entity coverage for additional markets and languages (U.S. Government clouds)

This update expands name and address coverage to an additional 7 countries, such as China and Russia, and expands medical terms and conditions (specifically for the Diseases SIT) to an additional 29 languages covering much of Europe, China, Japan, and Korea.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Priority account chat controls (Premium)
CurrentVersion.description: Administrators will be able to manage priority account chat controls using a policy setting. This enables end users to decide how to handle unwanted internal communications. End users will be notified about chats from new contacts, giving them a choice to accept or block the conversations. If conversations are blocked, all future messages from the sender will no longer be received. Senders can be unblocked at anytime by the users with these policies. This feature is available with a Teams Premium add-on license.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Priority account chat controls (Premium)
OldVersion.description:
Administrators
will be able to manage priority account chat controls using a policy setting.
This enables end users to decide how to handle unwanted internal
communications. End users will be notified about chats from new contacts,
giving them a choice to accept or block the conversations. If conversations are
blocked, all future messages from the sender will no longer be received.
Senders can be unblocked at anytime by the users with these policies. This
feature is available with a Teams Premium add-on license.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery (Premium) - App Permissions for Graph API
CurrentVersion.description: Now organizations who are automating eDiscovery workflows will be able to authenticate and execute workflows with an application based authentication method.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery (Premium) - App Permissions for Graph API
OldVersion.description: Now organizations who are automating eDiscovery workflows will be able to authenticate and execute workflows with an application based authentication method.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Lifecycle Management - Support for static and adaptive policy scopes for auto-apply retention labels targeting SITs in Exchange
CurrentVersion.description: Auto-apply retention labels targeting sensitive information types in Exchange will now support static include/exclude and adaptive policy scopes. Previously admins could only target all Exchange mailboxes.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Lifecycle Management - Support for static and adaptive policy scopes for auto-apply retention labels targeting SITs in Exchange
OldVersion.description: Auto-apply retention labels targeting sensitive information types in Exchange will now support static include/exclude and adaptive policy scopes. Previously admins could only target all Exchange mailboxes.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Microsoft Information Protection (MIP) ML Classifier support
CurrentVersion.description: Leverage trainable classifiers from Microsoft Information Protection (MIP) to recognize various content types specific to your organization. Insider Risk Management in Microsoft 365 correlates various signals from the chip to the cloud to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, security and policy violations, and more. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to ensure user-level privacy.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Microsoft Information Protection (MIP) ML Classifier support
OldVersion.description: Leverage trainable classifiers from Microsoft Information Protection (MIP) to recognize various content types specific to your organization. Insider Risk Management in Microsoft 365 correlates various signals from the chip to the cloud to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, security and policy violations, and more. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery - App Permissions for Graph API
CurrentVersion.description: Now organizations who are automating eDiscovery workflows will be able to authenticate and execute workflows with an application based authentication method.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery - App Permissions for Graph API
OldVersion.description: Now organizations who are automating eDiscovery workflows will be able to authenticate and execute workflows with an application based authentication method.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Insider risk insights in DLP alerts
CurrentVersion.description:
With this update, a DLP analyst with the right permissions can access an insider risk summary of user activities that may lead to potential data security incidents, as a part of the DLP alert investigation experience in Microsoft Purview and Microsoft Defender. This feature can help analysts gain context of a DLP alert and make more informed decisions on responses to potential incidents.
Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Insider risk insights in DLP alerts
OldVersion.description:

This feature can help analysts gain context of a DLP alert and make more informed decisions on responses to potential incidents.
Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Global Address List updates in new Outlook for Windows and Outlook on the Web
CurrentVersion.description: We are making some adjustments to the GAL search and browse experiences. Users will be asked to type in more characters to refine their search in some cases. There will be some other visual improvements in error messaging. Another way to find recipients is by using the suggestion dropdown picker in the To/Cc/Bcc lines. #newoutlookforwindows.

OldVersion.title: Outlook: Global Address List updates in new Outlook for Windows and Outlook on the Web
OldVersion.description: We are making some adjustments to the GAL search and browse experiences. Users will be asked to type in more characters to refine their search in some cases. There will be some other visual improvements in error messaging. Another way to find recipients is by using the suggestion dropdown picker in the To/Cc/Bcc lines. #newoutlookforwindows.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - Simulation mode for DLP
CurrentVersion.description: With this capability, Admins will be able to try a Microsoft Purview DLP policy, assess its impact, and fine tune the policy as required in an isolated environment. This will help Admins build confidence in the configuration of the policy and reduce the policy enforcement time.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - Simulation mode for DLP
OldVersion.description: With this capability, Admins will be able to try a Microsoft Purview DLP policy, assess its impact, and fine tune the policy as required in an isolated environment. This will help Admins build confidence in the configuration of the policy and reduce the policy enforcement time.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Communication Compliance - Schedule reports
CurrentVersion.description: The feature enables users to schedule the export of reports on a recurring or on-demand basis. Additionally, users will be notified when the exported report or items are ready for use and download.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Communication Compliance - Schedule reports
OldVersion.description: The feature enables users to schedule the export of reports on a recurring or on-demand basis. Additionally, users will be notified when the exported report or items are ready for use and download.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Share to Teams will be added to the ribbon in the new Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description: Users will now be able to find a "Share to Teams" button in the ribbon whenever they select an email in the reading pane. #newoutlookforwindows

OldVersion.title: Outlook: Share to Teams will be added to the ribbon in the new Outlook for Windows
OldVersion.description: Users will now be able to find a "Share to Teams" button in the ribbon whenever they select an email in the reading pane. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Apps now supported in group chats with external users
CurrentVersion.description: Users can now access applications in group chats with individuals outside their organization, fostering improved collaboration, interactivity, and productivity. The group chat’s host involving external participants can install, remove, or update applications for use by all members.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Apps now supported in group chats with external users
OldVersion.description: Users can now access applications in group chats with individuals outside their organization, fostering improved collaboration, interactivity, and productivity. The group chat’s host involving external participants can install, remove, or update applications for use by all members.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - Enhancements to the device onboarding page
CurrentVersion.description: This adds new enhancements to the device onboarding page, including these: search by IP address to look up devices, filter using the new "Valid user" filter, use a refined device list to only include devices that can be DLP supported (exclude Android devices from showing in the device onboarding list), and use new properties in the export report (valid user, first onboarded date, MDATP device ID, Defender engine version, Defender Mocamp version, Endpoint DLP status, last policy sync time, and Advanced Classification bandwidth usage exceeded).

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - Enhancements to the device onboarding page
OldVersion.description: This adds new enhancements to the device onboarding page, including these: search by IP address to look up devices, filter using the new "Valid user" filter, use a refined device list to only include devices that can be DLP supported (exclude Android devices from showing in the device onboarding list), and use new properties in the export report (valid user, first onboarded date, MDATP device ID, Defender engine version, Defender Mocamp version, Endpoint DLP status, last policy sync time, and Advanced Classification bandwidth usage exceeded).

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Swipe in the Message List on Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description: The Message List will now support Swipe from Left and Swipe from Right actions on Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows. As a result, some minor organization changes will also happen for the hover actions. #newoutlookforwindows

OldVersion.title: Outlook: Swipe in the Message List on Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows
OldVersion.description: The Message List will now support Swipe from Left and Swipe from Right actions on Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows. As a result, some minor organization changes will also happen for the hover actions. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Meeting Details in the Reading Pane on Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description: When a conversation in Mail is part of a meeting, the Reading Pane will have a new and improved Meeting Details card for a more efficient and modern RSVP flow. This will come to Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows. #newoutlookforwindows

OldVersion.title: Outlook: Meeting Details in the Reading Pane on Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows
OldVersion.description: When a conversation in Mail is part of a meeting, the Reading Pane will have a new and improved Meeting Details card for a more efficient and modern RSVP flow. This will come to Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Stream: Changes to version history for Stream videos
CurrentVersion.description: Stream (on SharePoint) video files tend to be large and consume considerable space against your OneDrive and SharePoint storage quotas. Currently, when you make changes to video metadata, such as adjustments to the video title, description, transcript, chapters, interactivity, thumbnails, or media settings, those changes trigger a new version (that includes both the video and metadata) to be created and stored in the version history for that file. Each of these versions consumes storage that counts towards your storage quota. To reduce the storage footprint driven by small changes, we are adjusting how Stream (on SharePoint) handles versions. Soon we will release an update to Stream version history. Once released, any changes made to the metadata of Stream files will no longer trigger an entirely new version in the file's version history. Instead, it will update the metadata of the most current version of the video in version history. If you edit the video itself, then a new version that includes both the video and metadata will be created and stored in the version history. Note: The update to Stream version history applies to Stream videos stored in OneDrive and SharePoint. SharePoint is also introducing new version history limits and controls that help tenant and site admins or document library owners reduce the storage footprint driven by low value file versions. These new version history limits and controls will only apply to Stream videos if changes to the video are made from within a SharePoint document library without opening the video in Stream (e.g. a file name change from within a SharePoint doc library). See Microsoft 365 Roadmap ID 145802 for more information on version history limits and controls.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Stream: Changes to version history for Stream videos
OldVersion.description: Stream (on SharePoint) video files tend to be large and consume considerable space against your OneDrive and SharePoint storage quotas. Currently, when you make changes to video metadata, such as adjustments to the video title, description, transcript, chapters, interactivity, thumbnails, or media settings, those changes trigger a new version (that includes both the video and metadata) to be created and stored in the version history for that file. Each of these versions consumes storage that counts towards your storage quota. To reduce the storage footprint driven by small changes, we are adjusting how Stream (on SharePoint) handles versions. Soon we will release an update to Stream version history. Once released, any changes made to the metadata of Stream files will no longer trigger an entirely new version in the file's version history. Instead, it will update the metadata of the most current version of the video in version history. If you edit the video itself, then a new version that includes both the video and metadata will be created and stored in the version history. Note: The update to Stream version history applies to Stream videos stored in OneDrive and SharePoint. SharePoint is also introducing new version history limits and controls that help tenant and site admins or document library owners reduce the storage footprint driven by low value file versions. These new version history limits and controls will only apply to Stream videos if changes to the video are made from within a SharePoint document library without opening the video in Stream (e.g. a file name change from within a SharePoint doc library). See Microsoft 365 Roadmap ID 145802 for more information on version history limits and controls.

CurrentVersion.title: Word: Automatic summary of documents on file-open in Word
CurrentVersion.description: When you open a document, Copilot will generate a summary in the Word window. You can hide the summary or open the Copilot chat pane to ask specific questions about the document.

OldVersion.title: Word: Automatic summary of documents on file-open in Word
OldVersion.description: When you open a document, Copilot will generate a summary in the Word window. You can hide the summary or open the Copilot chat pane to ask specific questions about the document.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Teams premium feature usage report for administrators in Teams admin center (Premium)
CurrentVersion.description: Teams Premium feature usage report in the Microsoft Teams admin center (TAC) will help administrators understand the usage of various Teams Premium features across users in their organization.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Teams premium feature usage report for administrators in Teams admin center (Premium)
OldVersion.description: Teams Premium feature usage report in the Microsoft Teams admin center (TAC) will help administrators understand the usage of various Teams Premium features across users in their organization.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: new role added for built-in Compliance Administrator, Organization Management, Purview Administrators role groups
CurrentVersion.description: Microsoft Purview provides a unified solution for managing data security, governance, compliance, and privacy across your organization's landscape. Specific Microsoft Purview built-in role groups are being extended with a new role to prepare for upcoming features and capabilities relevant to those role groups: Compliance Administrator, Organization Management, and Purview Administrators role groups. This change will not disrupt the current capabilities for these role groups; it will enable admins in these built-in groups to manage Purview resources within Purview administrative unit scopes in the future.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: new role added for built-in Compliance Administrator, Organization Management, Purview Administrators role groups
OldVersion.description: Microsoft Purview provides a unified solution for managing data security, governance, compliance, and privacy across your organization's landscape. Specific Microsoft Purview built-in role groups are being extended with a new role to prepare for upcoming features and capabilities relevant to those role groups: Compliance Administrator, Organization Management, and Purview Administrators role groups. This change will not disrupt the current capabilities for these role groups; it will enable admins in these built-in groups to manage Purview resources within Purview administrative unit scopes in the future.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Show/hide discover feed
CurrentVersion.description: You will now have the flexibility to show or hide (turn off/turn on) discover feed. Users can access this new toggle from the general settings section.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Show/hide discover feed
OldVersion.description: You will now have the flexibility to show or hide (turn off/turn on) discover feed. Users can access this new toggle from the general settings section.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Receive coaching on your writing in Copilot in Word
CurrentVersion.description: The Copilot context menu will include an option for getting AI-generated coaching. Copilot will review the writing and offer suggestions for high-impact areas, such as logical structure, flow, and tone.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Receive coaching on your writing in Copilot in Word
OldVersion.description: The Copilot context menu will include an option for getting AI-generated coaching. Copilot will review the writing and offer suggestions for high-impact areas, such as logical structure, flow, and tone.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Administrative Units for Teams Administration
CurrentVersion.description: We are excited to announce the availability of administrative units (AUs) for Teams administration. AUs are a way to delegate admin roles and delegate administration to a subset of users in your organization, based on attributes such as department, location, or business unit. With AUs, you can create more granular and flexible management scenarios for your Teams environment. You can assign the following roles, allowing them to manage only the users, groups & devices within their AU: Teams Administrator Teams Device Administrator Teams Communication Administrator Teams Communication Support Engineer Teams Communication Support Specialist Teams Telephony Administrator

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Administrative Units for Teams Administration
OldVersion.description: We are excited to announce the availability of administrative units (AUs) for Teams administration. AUs are a way to delegate admin roles and delegate administration to a subset of users in your organization, based on attributes such as department, location, or business unit. With AUs, you can create more granular and flexible management scenarios for your Teams environment. You can assign the following roles, allowing them to manage only the users, groups & devices within their AU: Teams Administrator Teams Device Administrator Teams Communication Administrator Teams Communication Support Engineer Teams Communication Support Specialist Teams Telephony Administrator

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Excel – Preview and "Apply" changes suggested by Copilot
CurrentVersion.description: Previously, when a user asked Copilot to make changes to their table data, Copilot would make the changes directly. Now, Copilot will respond with a description of the planned changes, along with a button to "Apply". Users can choose to refine before applying. This provides more user awareness and control over Copilot's changes.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Excel – Preview and "Apply" changes suggested by Copilot
OldVersion.description: Previously, when a user asked Copilot to make changes to their table data, Copilot would make the changes directly. Now, Copilot will respond with a description of the planned changes, along with a button to "Apply". Users can choose to refine before applying. This provides more user awareness and control over Copilot's changes.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Delegate Onboarding
CurrentVersion.description: The Delegate Onboarding feature aims to streamline the process of assigning delegate and delegate manager roles within the Viva Engage platform. By allowing users to request delegate permissions from delegators directly, the feature seeks to reduce the cognitive load and time costs associated with the current manual process, ultimately facilitating faster and more efficient delegate assignments.

CurrentVersion.title: OneDrive: View PDFs with Purview Information Protection sensitivity labels on OneDrive Mobile
CurrentVersion.description: With this capability, OneDrive users can open PDF files that are protected with Microsoft Purview Information Protection sensitivity labels and read them using OneDrive mobile apps in read-only mode. Only authorized users will be able to access these PDF files.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Pulse - Pulse administrators can export Pulse data?
CurrentVersion.description: Viva Pulse administrators can now search for and export a user's Pulse report, user level, and tenant-level data to a .xlsx file.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Pulse - Notifications management for administrators to configure where Pulse notifications are delivered
CurrentVersion.description: Pulse administrators can configure where Pulse notifications are delivered.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage – Verified Answers
CurrentVersion.description: Certain users like experts and admins will be able to mark answers to questions as verified answers to signal a credible and accurate answer. Questions with verified answers will receive its own special verified label and badge at the top of the question and on the verified answer. The goal of verified answers is to help enhance the trust and utility of knowledge in Viva Engage.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage – Questions surfacing in Copilot results
CurrentVersion.description: Viva Engage questions from communities, storyline, and Answers will surface in Copilot results.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage – Engage content surfacing in Copilot results
CurrentVersion.description: Community discussion posts from Viva Engage will surface in Copilot results.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Amplify - Required approval
CurrentVersion.description:
Coming soon, you'll be able to require approval at the campaign level for all your Amplify publications. The require approval feature brings compliance, accountability, and workflows to Lightweight Approvals in Amplify. By enabling required approval for a campaign, stakeholders can ensure that all campaign content adheres to organizational standards and receive the necessary approval before publishing, thus minimizing risks and errors. 

You can require approval at the campaign level so that all Amplify publications within the campaign go through the approval process before the content is published. This is an optional setting that a user can choose to apply to a campaign. By requiring approval, organizations can apply a significant level of quality and security to their content, ensuring every piece of content aligns perfectly with their standards and expectations before it is published.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Connections News Notifications in Gov Clouds
CurrentVersion.description:
With this release, existing news notifications in Viva Connections will now be available in GCC, GCCH and DoD. News notifications are delivered via Microsoft Teams in the desktop, mobile, and web environments in the following scenarios: News is published to a SharePoint team or communication site a user follows or by someone a user works closely with.
News is boosted. Someone comments on a new News post. Someone "Likes" a News post. Someone is @mentioned in a comment on a news post.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365: Multi-Geo In-Region Routing
CurrentVersion.description: Multi-Geo In-Region Routing enables customers with regional data compliance requirements to control the routing of inbound mail so that the mail enters Exchange Online in the geo-region hosting a specific user and the mail is fully processed and stored in the user's region, even if that user is in a different geo-region than the user's tenant.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: User uploaded custom background images for the new VDI solution for Microsoft Teams
CurrentVersion.description: If users want to change what appears behind them in their video meeting or call, they can either blur their background, use Teams virtual background templates, or with a Teams Premium license, they can change their Teams meeting background to a branded logo or image specific to their company. With this new feature, now users on the new VDI solution for Teams can also replace their background entirely with any image they want by uploading it through the 'Video effects and Settings' option.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Import HRIS data in Viva Glint from Microsoft Admin Center
CurrentVersion.description: Customers will be able to use various connectors to HRIS tools to import HRIS data into Viva Glint from Microsoft Admin Center.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Ability for all participants to start collaborative annotations
CurrentVersion.description: All participants in meetings are now able to start collaborative annotations. This will only be available in the new Microsoft Teams experience.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Ability for all participants to start collaborative annotations
OldVersion.description: All participants in meetings are now able to start collaborative annotations. This will only be available in the new Microsoft Teams experience.

CurrentVersion.description: This roadmap item was cancelled as the feature was deprecated due to low usage. We apologize for any inconvenience. IT admins will be able to add external partners with phone-based Teams accounts not managed by an organization to their organization’s extended directory. These external users can have a company curated user profile including location and job role. Users in the organization, who are enabled for Teams external access, can search for these external users by name and establish 1:1 or group chats, just like they do with internal users.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Slash Commands
CurrentVersion.description: User will be able to type slash in Teams compose box and select a command, helping them complete their task quickly.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal : Insider Risk Management – Bring your own detections
CurrentVersion.description:
Allow customers to bring their own user activity indicators from homegrown, SIEM/UEBA platforms, or other line-of-business applications, and leverage them in existing Insider Risk Management playbooks. Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/insider-risk-management?view=o365-worldwide

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Ability for meeting participants to edit their display name
CurrentVersion.description: Teams meeting participants will be able to edit their display name, enabling more flexibility in their meeting presence, regardless of their tenant set display name. Users can make this change during the meeting and it will persist throughout the duration of the meeting.

CurrentVersion.title: SharePoint: Copilot in SharePoint
CurrentVersion.description: Copilot in SharePoint combines the power of Large Language Models (LLMs), your data in the Microsoft Graph, and best practices to create engaging web content.  Get assistance drafting your content when creating new pages. Adjust the tone, expand meeting bullets into structured text, or get help making your message more concise. All within our existing commitments to data security and privacy in the enterprise.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection - Named entity coverage for additional markets and languages
CurrentVersion.description: Named entities are sensitive information types (SITs) that can’t easily be identified by a regular expression or a function; these include person names, physical addresses, and medical terms and conditions. This update expands name and address coverage to an additional 7 countries, such as China and Russia, and expands medical terms and conditions (specifically for the Diseases SIT) to an additional 29 languages covering much of Europe, China, Japan, and Korea.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection - Named entity coverage for additional markets and languages (U.S. Government clouds)
CurrentVersion.description: Named entities are sensitive information types (SITs) that can’t easily be identified by a regular expression or a function; these include person names, physical addresses, and medical terms and conditions. This update expands name and address coverage to an additional 7 countries, such as China and Russia, and expands medical terms and conditions (specifically for the Diseases SIT) to an additional 29 languages covering much of Europe, China, Japan, and Korea.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Priority account chat controls (Premium)
CurrentVersion.description: Administrators will be able to manage priority account chat controls using a policy setting. This enables end users to decide how to handle unwanted internal communications. End users will be notified about chats from new contacts, giving them a choice to accept or block the conversations. If conversations are blocked, all future messages from the sender will no longer be received. Senders can be unblocked at anytime by the users with these policies. This feature is available with a Teams Premium add-on license.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery (Premium) - App Permissions for Graph API
CurrentVersion.description: Now organizations who are automating eDiscovery workflows will be able to authenticate and execute workflows with an application based authentication method.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Lifecycle Management - Support for static and adaptive policy scopes for auto-apply retention labels targeting SITs in Exchange
CurrentVersion.description: Auto-apply retention labels targeting sensitive information types in Exchange will now support static include/exclude and adaptive policy scopes. Previously admins could only target all Exchange mailboxes.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Microsoft Information Protection (MIP) ML Classifier support
CurrentVersion.description: Leverage trainable classifiers from Microsoft Information Protection (MIP) to recognize various content types specific to your organization. Insider Risk Management in Microsoft 365 correlates various signals from the chip to the cloud to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, security and policy violations, and more. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery - App Permissions for Graph API
CurrentVersion.description: Now organizations who are automating eDiscovery workflows will be able to authenticate and execute workflows with an application based authentication method.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Insider risk insights in DLP alerts
CurrentVersion.description:
With this update, a DLP analyst with the right permissions can access an insider risk summary of user activities that may lead to potential data security incidents, as a part of the DLP alert investigation experience in Microsoft Purview and Microsoft Defender. This feature can help analysts gain context of a DLP alert and make more informed decisions on responses to potential incidents.
Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Global Address List updates in new Outlook for Windows and Outlook on the Web
CurrentVersion.description: We are making some adjustments to the GAL search and browse experiences. Users will be asked to type in more characters to refine their search in some cases. There will be some other visual improvements in error messaging. Another way to find recipients is by using the suggestion dropdown picker in the To/Cc/Bcc lines. #newoutlookforwindows.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - Simulation mode for DLP
CurrentVersion.description: With this capability, Admins will be able to try a Microsoft Purview DLP policy, assess its impact, and fine tune the policy as required in an isolated environment. This will help Admins build confidence in the configuration of the policy and reduce the policy enforcement time.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Communication Compliance - Schedule reports
CurrentVersion.description: The feature enables users to schedule the export of reports on a recurring or on-demand basis. Additionally, users will be notified when the exported report or items are ready for use and download.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management-Insider risk insights in DLP alerts
CurrentVersion.description:
With this update, a DLP analyst with the right permissions can access an insider risk summary of user activities that may lead to potential data security incidents, as a part of the DLP alert investigation experience in Microsoft Purview and Microsoft Defender. This feature can help analysts gain context of a DLP alert and make more informed decisions on responses to potential incidents.
Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Share to Teams will be added to the ribbon in the new Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description: Users will now be able to find a "Share to Teams" button in the ribbon whenever they select an email in the reading pane. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Apps now supported in group chats with external users
CurrentVersion.description: Users can now access applications in group chats with individuals outside their organization, fostering improved collaboration, interactivity, and productivity. The group chat’s host involving external participants can install, remove, or update applications for use by all members.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - Enhancements to the device onboarding page
CurrentVersion.description: This adds new enhancements to the device onboarding page, including these: search by IP address to look up devices, filter using the new "Valid user" filter, use a refined device list to only include devices that can be DLP supported (exclude Android devices from showing in the device onboarding list), and use new properties in the export report (valid user, first onboarded date, MDATP device ID, Defender engine version, Defender Mocamp version, Endpoint DLP status, last policy sync time, and Advanced Classification bandwidth usage exceeded).

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Swipe in the Message List on Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description: The Message List will now support Swipe from Left and Swipe from Right actions on Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows. As a result, some minor organization changes will also happen for the hover actions. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Meeting Details in the Reading Pane on Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description: When a conversation in Mail is part of a meeting, the Reading Pane will have a new and improved Meeting Details card for a more efficient and modern RSVP flow. This will come to Outlook on the Web and the New Outlook for Windows. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Stream: Changes to version history for Stream videos
CurrentVersion.description: Stream (on SharePoint) video files tend to be large and consume considerable space against your OneDrive and SharePoint storage quotas. Currently, when you make changes to video metadata, such as adjustments to the video title, description, transcript, chapters, interactivity, thumbnails, or media settings, those changes trigger a new version (that includes both the video and metadata) to be created and stored in the version history for that file. Each of these versions consumes storage that counts towards your storage quota. To reduce the storage footprint driven by small changes, we are adjusting how Stream (on SharePoint) handles versions. Soon we will release an update to Stream version history. Once released, any changes made to the metadata of Stream files will no longer trigger an entirely new version in the file's version history. Instead, it will update the metadata of the most current version of the video in version history. If you edit the video itself, then a new version that includes both the video and metadata will be created and stored in the version history. Note: The update to Stream version history applies to Stream videos stored in OneDrive and SharePoint. SharePoint is also introducing new version history limits and controls that help tenant and site admins or document library owners reduce the storage footprint driven by low value file versions. These new version history limits and controls will only apply to Stream videos if changes to the video are made from within a SharePoint document library without opening the video in Stream (e.g. a file name change from within a SharePoint doc library). See Microsoft 365 Roadmap ID 145802 for more information on version history limits and controls.

CurrentVersion.title: Word: Automatic summary of documents on file-open in Word
CurrentVersion.description: When you open a document, Copilot will generate a summary in the Word window. You can hide the summary or open the Copilot chat pane to ask specific questions about the document.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Teams premium feature usage report for administrators in Teams admin center (Premium)
CurrentVersion.description: Teams Premium feature usage report in the Microsoft Teams admin center (TAC) will help administrators understand the usage of various Teams Premium features across users in their organization.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: new role added for built-in Compliance Administrator, Organization Management, Purview Administrators role groups
CurrentVersion.description: Microsoft Purview provides a unified solution for managing data security, governance, compliance, and privacy across your organization's landscape. Specific Microsoft Purview built-in role groups are being extended with a new role to prepare for upcoming features and capabilities relevant to those role groups: Compliance Administrator, Organization Management, and Purview Administrators role groups. This change will not disrupt the current capabilities for these role groups; it will enable admins in these built-in groups to manage Purview resources within Purview administrative unit scopes in the future.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Show/hide discover feed
CurrentVersion.description: You will now have the flexibility to show or hide (turn off/turn on) discover feed. Users can access this new toggle from the general settings section.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Receive coaching on your writing in Copilot in Word
CurrentVersion.description: The Copilot context menu will include an option for getting AI-generated coaching. Copilot will review the writing and offer suggestions for high-impact areas, such as logical structure, flow, and tone.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Administrative Units for Teams Administration
CurrentVersion.description: We are excited to announce the availability of administrative units (AUs) for Teams administration. AUs are a way to delegate admin roles and delegate administration to a subset of users in your organization, based on attributes such as department, location, or business unit. With AUs, you can create more granular and flexible management scenarios for your Teams environment. You can assign the following roles, allowing them to manage only the users, groups & devices within their AU: Teams Administrator Teams Device Administrator Teams Communication Administrator Teams Communication Support Engineer Teams Communication Support Specialist Teams Telephony Administrator

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Excel – Preview and "Apply" changes suggested by Copilot
CurrentVersion.description: Previously, when a user asked Copilot to make changes to their table data, Copilot would make the changes directly. Now, Copilot will respond with a description of the planned changes, along with a button to "Apply". Users can choose to refine before applying. This provides more user awareness and control over Copilot's changes.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Delegate Onboarding
CurrentVersion.description: The Delegate Onboarding feature aims to streamline the process of assigning delegate and delegate manager roles within the Viva Engage platform. By allowing users to request delegate permissions from delegators directly, the feature seeks to reduce the cognitive load and time costs associated with the current manual process, ultimately facilitating faster and more efficient delegate assignments.

CurrentVersion.title: OneDrive: View PDFs with Purview Information Protection sensitivity labels on OneDrive Mobile
CurrentVersion.description: With this capability, OneDrive users can open PDF files that are protected with Microsoft Purview Information Protection sensitivity labels and read them using OneDrive mobile apps in read-only mode. Only authorized users will be able to access these PDF files.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Pulse - Pulse administrators can export Pulse data?
CurrentVersion.description: Viva Pulse administrators can now search for and export a user's Pulse report, user level, and tenant-level data to a .xlsx file.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Pulse - Notifications management for administrators to configure where Pulse notifications are delivered
CurrentVersion.description: Pulse administrators can configure where Pulse notifications are delivered.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage – Verified Answers
CurrentVersion.description: Certain users like experts and admins will be able to mark answers to questions as verified answers to signal a credible and accurate answer. Questions with verified answers will receive its own special verified label and badge at the top of the question and on the verified answer. The goal of verified answers is to help enhance the trust and utility of knowledge in Viva Engage.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage – Questions surfacing in Copilot results
CurrentVersion.description: Viva Engage questions from communities, storyline, and Answers will surface in Copilot results.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage – Engage content surfacing in Copilot results
CurrentVersion.description: Community discussion posts from Viva Engage will surface in Copilot results.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Amplify - Required approval
CurrentVersion.description:
Coming soon, you'll be able to require approval at the campaign level for all your Amplify publications. The require approval feature brings compliance, accountability, and workflows to Lightweight Approvals in Amplify. By enabling required approval for a campaign, stakeholders can ensure that all campaign content adheres to organizational standards and receive the necessary approval before publishing, thus minimizing risks and errors. 

You can require approval at the campaign level so that all Amplify publications within the campaign go through the approval process before the content is published. This is an optional setting that a user can choose to apply to a campaign. By requiring approval, organizations can apply a significant level of quality and security to their content, ensuring every piece of content aligns perfectly with their standards and expectations before it is published.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Connections News Notifications in Gov Clouds
CurrentVersion.description:
With this release, existing news notifications in Viva Connections will now be available in GCC, GCCH and DoD. News notifications are delivered via Microsoft Teams in the desktop, mobile, and web environments in the following scenarios: News is published to a SharePoint team or communication site a user follows or by someone a user works closely with.
News is boosted. Someone comments on a new News post. Someone "Likes" a News post. Someone is @mentioned in a comment on a news post.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365: Multi-Geo In-Region Routing
CurrentVersion.description: Multi-Geo In-Region Routing enables customers with regional data compliance requirements to control the routing of inbound mail so that the mail enters Exchange Online in the geo-region hosting a specific user and the mail is fully processed and stored in the user's region, even if that user is in a different geo-region than the user's tenant.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: User uploaded custom background images for the new VDI solution for Microsoft Teams
CurrentVersion.description: If users want to change what appears behind them in their video meeting or call, they can either blur their background, use Teams virtual background templates, or with a Teams Premium license, they can change their Teams meeting background to a branded logo or image specific to their company. With this new feature, now users on the new VDI solution for Teams can also replace their background entirely with any image they want by uploading it through the 'Video effects and Settings' option.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Import HRIS data in Viva Glint from Microsoft Admin Center
CurrentVersion.description: Customers will be able to use various connectors to HRIS tools to import HRIS data into Viva Glint from Microsoft Admin Center.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Ability for all participants to start collaborative annotations
CurrentVersion.description: All participants in meetings are now able to start collaborative annotations. This will only be available in the new Microsoft Teams experience.
